caption: Application
description: An Application describes the details for an inventoried application as reported by an Application Security tool or other Developer-centric tooling. Applications can be defined as Kubernetes resources, Containerized resources, or application hosting-specific cloud sources such as AWS Elastic BeanStalk, AWS Lightsail, or Azure Logic Apps.
name: application

criticality.caption: Business Criticality
criticality.description: The criticality of the application as defined by the event source.

desc.caption: Application Description
desc.description: A description or commentary for an application, usually retrieved from an upstream system.

group.description: The name of the related application or associated resource group.

hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the application.

labels.description: The list of labels associated to the application.

owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the application.

region.description: The cloud region of the resource.

resource_relationship.caption: Application Relationship
resource_relationship.description: A graph representation showing how this application relates to and interacts with other entities in the environment. This can include parent/child relationships, dependencies, or other connections.

sbom.caption: Related SBOM
sbom.description: The Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) associated with the application

tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the application.

type.caption: Application Type
type.description: The type of application as defined by the event source, e.g., GitHub, Azure Logic App, or Amazon Elastic BeanStalk.

uid.caption: Application ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the application.

uid_alt.caption: Application Alternative ID
uid_alt.description: An alternative or contextual identifier for the application, such as a configuration, organization, or license UID.

version.caption: Application Version
version.description: The semantic version of the application, e.g., 1.7.4.
